Package ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers.EventController
@RequestMapping("/events") @RestController public class EventController extends Object
Controller that implements the API for Events
Author:
Rotem

  • Constructor Details

      public EventController()

  • Method Details

    • addEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, path="/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addEvent(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event event, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      Add a new event to the DB
      Parameters:
      event - the event object to add
      userId - the ID of the user that is adding the event
      Returns:
      the new event object with ID, error if the adding process failed

    • addEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=POST, path="/addlist/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addEvents(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      Add a list of new events to the DB
      Parameters:
      events - list of events to add
      userId - the userId of the user that adds the events
      Returns:
      the list of the events with ID, error if the adding process failed

    • getEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEvents(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map)
      get events according to the request parameters: startTime, endTime: all events in the range between startTime and endTime startTime, endTime, userId: all events in the range between startTime and endTime of user with id userId userId, numHours, numMinutes: all events in the upcoming numHours hours and numMinutes minutes of user with id userId userId: all events of user with id userId no param: all events in the DB
      Parameters:
      map - map of the request params
      Returns:
      the list of the required events, error if the get process failed

    • updateEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT, path="/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateEvent(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event event, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      update event in DB
      Parameters:
      event - the event object to update
      userId - the id of the user (only the owner of an event can update it)
      Returns:
      the updated event object, error if update failed

    • updateEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateEvents(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events)
      update list of events in DB
      Parameters:
      events - the events to update
      Returns:
      the updated list of events, error if the update failed

    • deactivateEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT, path="/{eventId}/deactivate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deactivateEvent(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      deactivate an event in DB deactivates all of the event notifications as well
      Parameters:
      eventId - the id of the event to deactivate
      Returns:
      the event object, error if the process failed

    • deactivateEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT, path="/deactivate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deactivateEvents(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventIds)
      deactivate events in DB deactivates all of the events notifications as well
      Parameters:
      eventIds - the ids of the events to deactivate
      Returns:
      a success message, error if the process failed

    • deleteEvent

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE, path="/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEvent(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      deletes event from db deletes all the event notifications as well
      Parameters:
      eventId - the id of the event to delete
      Returns:
      success message, error if the delete failed

    • deleteEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEvents(@RequestBody List<Integer> eventIds)
      delete events from db deletes all the events notifications as well
      Parameters:
      eventIds - the ids of the events to delete
      Returns:
      success message, error if the delete failed

    • getEventsById

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsById(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      get an event by its id
      Parameters:
      eventId - the id of the event to retrieve
      Returns:
      the event object, error if the process failed

    • getUpcomingUserEvents

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, path="/upcoming/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUpcomingUserEvents(@PathVariable Integer userId)
      get upcoming events of user (future events)
      Parameters:
      userId - the id of the user
      Returns:
      the list of the events, error if the process failed
